original: Lindman, Gösta Johan Engelbrekt, civilingenjör, direktör, Linköping, f. 3/ 12/78 i Gryt, Östergötl. 1., av Gustaf L. o. Olivia Engelbrecht. G. 06 m. Louise Flodin. Barn: Kurt f. 08, Gunnar 12. — Mogrex. i Norrköp. 97, ut-ex. fr. KTH (E) 00. Anst. v. General Electric Co. i Schenectady, NY, USA, 00-02, konstr. v. S :t Louis Transit Co., Mo., USA, 02-04, v. Los Angeles Raid-way Co. 04, v. ASEA i Västerås 05, chef f. banbyrå o. hissavd. v. Nyii Fören. Elektr. A-B 06-16, f. Elektr. A-B AEG banavd. i Sthlm 17-20, över-ing. v. A-B Sthlms Spårv. 21-24, verk-st. dir. f. Linköp. Elektr. Kraft & Be-lysn. A-B 24-44. Utf. bl. a. spårv. t. Enskede 08, i Gävle 09, Karlskrona 10, elektrifier. av MeJl. östergöti. Jarnv. 14-15 o. Lund-Bjärreds Järnv. 16. Ch. f. statens ind:komm. fotogenbyrå 17, f. Royal Swed. Comm. i New York 18-19, fullm. i Fera, v. ordf. i Motala ströms regler :fören. 33-44, dir. f. fastigh:bol. Stiftstaden o. Residensstaden, kommrfullm. i Stocksund 14, insp. f. Ljungstedtska sk. i Linköp., v. ordf. i luftsk:ndn, ordf. i Linköp. radiokiubb sed. 28, östergötl. tekn. fören. 31-34, Linköp. luftsk :fören. sed. 37 o. Linköp. civiförsvmd sed. 45, pres. i Linköp. Rotarykl. 35-36, styr :led. i Sv. e-lverksfören. 37-39. Medl. av Sv. tekn:fören., KAK, Travellers Club, Linköp. Rotarykl. Res. t. USA 00, 18 o. 20, jorden runt 04, Tyskl., HolL, Belg., Engl., Österr., Finl., Schw^eiz o Ital. Skr.: art. i tekn. frågor. Hob-bies: trädgiarb., foto, resor. RVO, ProPatrGM, RLSF förtj :t. i guld, Idr:Gm, SkytteSm.
translated: Lindman, Gösta Johan Engelbrekt, civil engineer, director, Linköping, b. 3/12/78 in Gryt, Östergötland. Son of Gustaf L. and Olivia Engelbrecht. Married to Louise Flodin since 1906. Children: Kurt b. 1908, Gunnar b. 1912. Employed at Mogrex in Norrköping from 1897. Graduated from KTH (E) in 1900. Worked at General Electric Co. in Schenectady, NY, USA from 1900-1902, as a designer at S:t Louis Transit Co., Mo., USA from 1902-1904, at Los Angeles Railway Co. in 1904, at ASEA in Västerås from 1905, as head of the railway department and elevator division at Nyii Fören. Elektr. A-B from 1906-1916, at Elektr. A-B AEG railway department in Stockholm from 1917-1920, as chief engineer at A-B Sthlms Spårv. from 1921-1924, as managing director at Linköp. Elektr. Kraft & Belysn. A-B from 1924-1944. Completed projects such as tram lines to Enskede in 1908, in Gävle in 1909, and in Karlskrona in 1910. Electrified MeJl. östergöti. Jarnv. from 1914-1915 and Lund-Bjärreds Järnv. in 1916. Chairman of the state's petroleum commission in 1917, representative of the Royal Swedish Commission in New York from 1918-1919, delegate to FERA (Federal Emergency Relief Administration), vice chairman of Motala ströms regler:fören. from 1933-1944, director of the Stiftstaden and Residensstaden real estate company, municipal representative in Stocksund in 1914, inspector at Ljungstedtska school in Linköping, vice chairman of the air navigation commission, chairman of Linköping radio club since 1928, chairman of the Östergötland Technical Association from 1931-1934, chairman of Linköping air defense association since 1937 and Linköping civil defense association since 1945, president of Linköping Rotary Club from 1935-1936, board member of the Swedish power company association from 1937-1939. Member of the Swedish technical association, KAK (the Royal Automobile Club), Travellers Club, and Linköping Rotary Club. Traveled to the United States in 1900, 1918, and 1920, around the world in 1904, and to Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, England, Austria, Finland, Switzerland, and Italy. Wrote articles on technical matters. Hobbies: gardening, photography, travel. Recipient of honors including RVO (Order of the Sword), Pro Patria Gold Medal, RLSF Merit Medal Gold Class, Idr:GM (Idrottsguldmedaljen - Sports Gold Medal), and SkytteSm (Skytteförbundets Guldmedalj - Shooting Association's Gold Medal).
